trans-unit.source: Represents a queued binding that is suitable for cross-machine communication.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding> binding provides support for queuing by using Message Queuing (MSMQ) as a transport and enables support for loosely-coupled applications, failure isolation, load leveling and disconnected operations.
For a discussion of these features, see [Queues Overview](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/queues-overview.md).
This is one of the system-provided bindings provided by [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)].

The recommended procedure is to define the binding using configuration values and not to use a code-based approach, except in certain advanced scenarios where configuration values must be set as a service is initialized.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding"></xref> class using the specified security mode.
The security mode with which to initialize the new instance.
The value is not one of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqSecurityMode"></xref> values.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding"></xref> class from the settings of a specified configuration binding element.
This name overwrites any configuration name at runtime that was assigned to the `NetMsmqBinding` element in a configuration file.
The value of the `configurationName` attribute that identifies the `binding` element whose settings are used to initialize the binding.
Returns an ordered collection of binding elements contained in the current binding.
The order of the binding elements is important.
It reflects the order in which the protocol and transport channels are constructed and stacked.
This collection of binding elements is a new collection and can be modified and then used to create a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CustomBinding>.
The ordered collection of binding elements described by the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding"></xref> binding.
Gets the version of SOAP that is used for messages processed by this binding.
The value of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion"></xref> that is used with this binding.
The default value is SOAP 1.2.
Gets or sets the maximum amount of memory that is allocated for use by the message buffer manager that receives messages from the channel.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BufferManager> minimizes the cost of using buffers by using a buffer pool.
Buffers are required to process messages by the service when they come out of the channel.

If there is not sufficient memory in the buffer pool to process the message load, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BufferManager> must allocate additional memory from the CLR heap, which increases the garbage collection overhead.

Extensive allocation from the CLR garbage heap is an indication that the buffer pool size is too small and that performance can be improved with a larger allocation by increasing the <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpBinding.MaxBufferPoolSize%2A> limit.
The maximum amount of memory, in bytes, available for use by the message buffer manager.
The default value is 524288 (0x80000) bytes.
Gets or sets an enumeration value that indicates the queued communication channel transport that this binding uses.

Message Queuing (MSMQ) does not support Active Directory addressing when using SOAP Reliable Messaging Protocol, so do not set <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding.QueueTransferProtocol%2A> to <xref:System.ServiceModel.QueueTransferProtocol.Srmp> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.QueueTransferProtocol.SrmpSecure> when <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding.UseActiveDirectory%2A> is set to `true`.
The transport between queue managers that this binding uses.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas"></xref> that is associated with this binding.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas> object defines constraints on the complexity of SOAP messages that can be processed by endpoints configured with a binding.
These constraints include `maxArrayLength`, `maxBytesPerRead`, `maxDepth`, `maxNameTableCharCount`, and `maxStringContentLength`.
These values aid in the prevention of denial of service attacks.
[!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/includes/crdefault-md.md)]<xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas"></xref> associated with this binding.
The value is `null`.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqSecurity"></xref> that is associated with this binding.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqSecurity> is an encapsulation of both Message Queuing (MSMQ) transport and SOAP security.
It specifies whether transport or SOAP security is enabled and, if so, what authentication mode and protection levels are in use.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqSecurity"></xref> that is associated with this binding.
Returns a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding.ReaderQuotas"></xref> property has changed from its default value and should be serialized.
`true` if the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding.ReaderQuotas"></xref> property value should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding.Security"></xref> property has changed from its default value and should be serialized.
`true` if the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding.Security"></xref> property value should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether queue addresses should be converted using Active Directory.
The Message Queuing (MSMQ) queue addresses can consist of path names or direct format names.
With a direct format name, Message Queuing resolves the queue name using DNS, NetBIOS or IP.
With a path name, Message Queuing resolves the queue name using Active Directory.
By default, the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] queued transport converts the URI of a message queue to a direct format name.

By setting the <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetMsmqBinding.UseActiveDirectory%2A> property to `true`, an application can specify that the queued transport should resolve the queue name using Active Directory rather than DNS, NetBIOS, or IP.
`true` if queue addresses should be converted using Active Directory; otherwise, `false`.
